alfredsnippet.snippet:
Sir Fred Hoyle, The big bang in astronomy, New Scientist, 19 Nov. 1981, p.524-526

"The notion that not only the biopolymers but the operating programme of a living cell could be arrived at by chance in a primordial organic soup here on the Earth is evidently nonsense of a high order. Life must plainly be a cosmic phenomenon."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Hoyle - Life Must Plainly Be a Cosmic Phenomenon
